New Records: DeMar DeRozan scored the final 9 points for the Kings in the second overtime
Key Match Events: Keon Ellis had 15 deflections in the game
Domantas Sabonis played 50 minutes and finished with 21 points, 18 rebounds, 11 assists, 3 blocks, and 1 steal
Malik Monk drove past Haywood Highsmith and had a clear look at the basket, but Monk didn’t realize how open he was and paused to gather before his shot, allowing Highsmith to block the shot
Keon Ellis got the ball in the corner, got Bam Adebayo in the air, and Ellis drew a foul with 0.2 seconds left
DeMar DeRozan secured the rebound and the Kings called timeout with 3.1 seconds remaining
Pre-Game Insights: Doug Christie rode the guys who led the comeback and let them finish the game
Doug Christie emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense
Post-Match Reflections: Doug Christie expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
DeMar DeRozan led the way on offense and the Kings as a whole played incredible defense to secure the 123-118 victory and extend Sacramento’s win streak to 5
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went to a second overtime
The Heat were forced to switch at times trying to get Keegan Murray off Tyler Herro
Keegan Murray was a big part of the game, hitting some 3s, rebounding, and playing great defense
Others: The Kings are off until Friday, when they’ll visit the Boston Celtics
Trust the guys who got you there
I still love you anyway, Malik
The Kings have a 5-game win streak
